title: Straight razor
summary: A straight razor is a razor with a blade that can fold into its handle.[1][2] They are also called open razors and cut-throat razors.[3][4][5] The predecessors of the modern straight razors include bronze razors, with cutting edges and fixed handles, produced by craftsmen from Ancient Egypt during the New Kingdom (1569 â€” 1081 BC). Solid gold and copper razors were also found in Ancient Egyptian tombs dating back to the 4th millennium BC.
